subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: The Chicago Cubs and Daryle Ward exercised a $1.2 million mutual option for next season, but the team declined options on outfielder Cliff Floyd and pitcher Steve Trachsel yesterday.Ward batted .327 in 79 games last season after signing as a free agent. Ward led the team with 54 pinch-hit appearances and went 11 for 41 (.268). Floyd hit .284 with 9 homers and 45 runs batted in. His option was for $5 million. Trachsel, acquired in a trade with Baltimore on Aug. 31, was 1-3 with an 8.31 earned run average in four starts for Chicago. Trachsel gets a $100,000 buyout. His option was for $4.75 million.
